chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tandy A Garvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be installed immediately. Time will not begin until defendant obtains a valid DL.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
May transfer to Wood County.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.
Complete AODA assessment and follow through.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work or treatment if defendant meets jail criteria. Defedant has 45 days to report. May transfer to Wood County if arrangements can be made.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tandy A Garvin

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:45pm
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher; Defendant appears in person, pro se. Other appearances: PO Wood County agent- Mandy Weigel appears by telephone.
Date and time set for defendant's request for early release from probation

COURT has received letter written by defendant on 2/12/18 requesting for early termination of probation due to seeking employment outside of state of Wisconsin
Deft states reason for early termination request
Agent Weigel states deft has many positive results while on probation, but Dept. is not able to request early discharge due to multiple OWI offenses
State is objecting to early discharge from probation due to already receiving leniency on OWI 5th by receiving 3 years probation and not prison which court now imposes on OWI 5th offenses
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: DENIES defendant's request for early probation discharge
Adj: 3:55pm
Defendant's Request for Early Release from Probation - 3/8/18 @ 3:45pm
Calendar call on February 26, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

to Court from Defendant re: early release from supervision

CC: ADA Sid Brubacher and Wood County Probation

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:04am
INCLUDES 15CF653 & (tracking) 15TR3528 & 15TR3529
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher.  Deft appears in person with Atty Leon Schmidt
Date and time was set for plea, but need to do waiver of preliminary hearing first
OTR: 9:07am
BOTR: 9:12am

Preliminary Hearing:
Waiver of  Prelim filed.  
COURT ques. Deft re: Waiver.   
COURT finds Waiver freely & vol. made, finds probable cause & binds Deft over for Trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived.

Plea:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CF653: Ct. 2 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> D&RI
State wishes to dismiss outright tracking cases 15TR3528 & 15TR3529
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
15CF653: Ct. 1 OWI (5th or 6th) >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation. CONDITONS: Pay $2452 fine inclusive of court costs, DNA surcharge.  Serve 9 months MCJ, with huber for work or treatment if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. 36 months driver's license revocation, administrative credit for any time already served. 36 months IID installed immediately, time will not begin until deft obtain's valid license. 6 points against driving record. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from alcohol. 3 days credit granted towards jail. Provide DNA sample. Probation and/or jail can be transfered to Wood County if MCJ and Wood County jail can arrange this. 

Adj: 9:33am
Prelim off; PTC 9/29/15 on to set further dates
Ltr dated 7/28/15 from Atty Leon S. Schmidt, Jr.

Pre-trial conference at 09-09-2015 04:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing at 09-18-2015 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 09-29-2015 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Shall not consume alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202-alcohol within 5 business days.
